neighbors.name: Buis Farms Eight LLC
neighbors.claims: Buis Farms Eight LLC holds farmland in Putnam County and is associated with the local Buis family farming enterprise (Mike & Jeff Buis Partnership) ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=18133&page=1&progcode=total_dp#:~:text=21%20%20,%24212%2C840)). The Buis partnership, based in nearby Martinsville, IN, has received over $217,000 in federal farm subsidies since 1995, reflecting the scale of their farm operations ([farm.ewg.org](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=18133&page=1&progcode=total_dp#:~:text=21%20%20,%24212%2C840)). No managing members or beneficial owners are publicly listed for Buis Farms Eight LLC (presumed to be members of the Buis family); the true ownership is not disclosed in state filings, making the beneficial owner unknown. No public records indicate Buis Farms Eight LLC taking an active position for or against development projects in the area (stance undocumented).
neighbors.influence_justification: Multi-generational farm family with substantial acreage and notable USDA subsidies; locally known but not overtly politically active

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Buis family principals (e.g., Mike Buis) with respect for their farming legacy; emphasize how any project can coexist with or enhance agricultural use to address their concerns

neighbors.name: Fred Mann Farm Inc
neighbors.claims: Fred Mann Farm Inc is a family-run farm corporation led by Fred O. Mann, headquartered in Cloverdale, Indiana ([www.buzzfile.com](https://www.buzzfile.com/business/White-Oak-Farm-765-795-3615#:~:text=Contact%3A%20%20,3615%20Website%3A)). The company’s address (5008 E State Rd 42) houses multiple Mann family business entities, indicating a large-scale farming operation with diversified holdings ([www.buzzfile.com](https://www.buzzfile.com/business/White-Oak-Farm-765-795-3615#:~:text=Website%3A%20%20)). The Mann family has deep roots in local agriculture (including a family limited partnership formed in 2001) and controls extensive farmland in the county ([www.buzzfile.com](https://www.buzzfile.com/business/White-Oak-Farm-765-795-3615#:~:text=Contact%3A%20%20,3615%20Website%3A)). Members of the Mann family have actively engaged in development discussions – for example, partnering with a solar developer through their related LLC – suggesting this farm entity would support projects that offer financial returns on their land ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-commissioners-set-to-have-final-say-on-proposed-solar-farm/#:~:text=The%20land%20in%20question%20belongs,to%20the%20Mann%20family)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-established major landowners (~2,000 acres); multiple farm-related entities; prominent in local land-use debates

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with patriarch Fred Mann and family decision-makers; frame proposals as enhancing the farm’s legacy and profitability, given their past openness to new ventures

neighbors.name: Mann Family Investments LLC
neighbors.claims: Mann Family Investments LLC was registered in Indiana on November 29, 2010, with registered agent Robert N. Mann at 5008 E State Road 42, Cloverdale ([www.incompanygo.info](https://www.incompanygo.info/companies/2010112900433/#:~:text=MANN%20FAMILY%20INVESTMENTS%2C%20LLC%20was,Family%20Investments%2C%20Llcis%20%3A%20Active)) ([www.incompanygo.info](https://www.incompanygo.info/companies/2010112900433/#:~:text=The%20agent%20name%20of%20this,Investments%2C%20Llcis%20%3A%20Active%20now)). It is one of the Mann family’s business entities used to manage and invest in their land assets beyond day-to-day farming ([www.incompanygo.info](https://www.incompanygo.info/companies/2010112900433/#:~:text=MANN%20FAMILY%20INVESTMENTS%2C%20LLC%20was,Family%20Investments%2C%20Llcis%20%3A%20Active)). In 2025, land owned by the Mann family (about 2,000 acres) was proposed as the site of a utility-scale solar project (the 4Leaf Solar farm by developer energyRe) as a way to “diversify” their farming operations and improve soil quality ([www.giant.fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-commissioners-set-to-have-final-say-on-proposed-solar-farm/#:~:text=The%20land%20in%20question%20belongs,to%20the%20Mann%20family)). However, that solar project’s rezoning was denied in a 2–1 vote by county commissioners following significant community opposition in October 2025 ([terrehautevice.com](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/#:~:text=Putnam%20County%2C%20IN%20%E2%80%94%20In,spanned%20roughly%202%2C000%20acres%20between)). Despite the setback, the LLC’s involvement in pursuing renewable energy indicates that the Mann family is open to development opportunities that monetize their land holdings.
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls large land assets; family members spoke publicly in favor of major development; directly involved in local planning decisions

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Robert Mann (managing member) directly to discuss mutually beneficial development plans; leverage their interest in diversification by offering partnerships or concessions that address past community concerns

neighbors.name: Crafton Thomas R Trust
neighbors.influence_justification: Trust associated with an individual landowner; minimal public information available

overview_summary: The identified neighbors are primarily long-established farming entities managed by local families in Putnam County. The Mann family controls about 2,000 acres and even explored hosting a large solar farm on their land, indicating a willingness to partner on development. In contrast, other neighbors like the Buis family’s LLC have not publicly stated a stance; as multi-generational farmers, they may prioritize preserving farmland unless offered compelling incentives. Overall, these landowners carry weight in the community through their acreage and could either support or oppose new projects based on how those projects align with their agricultural interests.
